title: Strictly Kelvin Fletcher gym routine revealed during training
text:
Kelvin is staying in shape (Picture: Wenn/Instagram)

Kelvin Fletcher has been getting the judges and let’s face it, pretty much every viewer hot under the collar on Strictly Come Dancing.

But it takes a whole lot of training to get to that stage.

The Emmerdale star has revealed how he’s keeping fit during his Strictly journey and sadly, it’s not with a diet of hash browns and daily massages.

Kelvin 35, shared his fitness diary with GQ and explained that while he used to go to the gym three to four times a week, his regime during Strictly is even more ‘intense’.

The star hits the gym between 5am and 5.30am on Mondays and spends an hour and a half working out before he’s even had his breakfast.

Kelvin and Oti never stop (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC/BBC/PA Wire)

He said: ‘Mobility, activate whatever muscles, a full-body session every time, some full-body exercises and some upper-body exercises. Doing a rep range of 12-15 and working at about 75 per cent of your max RPM.

‘Nothing too strenuous, just keep the blood flowing. I’ve taken out the big compound lifts: no deadlifts, no squatting.’

Kelvin then heads to rehearsals with partner Oti Mabuse at 10am – and dances until 10pm.

Ouch.

Kelvin repeats the gym routine from Monday to Thursday, and rehearses with Oti from 10am to 8pm on Wednesday and 10am to 6pm on Thursday.

Speaking about his diet, he said: ‘I probably eat about 300-350g of carbs a day. About 160g of protein, about 60-80g of fat, which I think is about 2,500-3,000 calories.

‘Carbs get a bad press, but they’re pretty important. I’ve stayed pretty lean, I’m about five kilos lighter than I was a couple of months ago. Which is fine, I think – it helps with the dancing.’

Well, he’s doing something right – Kelvin is one of the firm favourites to lift the Glitterball trophy after consistently impressing the judges and even achieving the first 10s of the series with his week three Charleston.

The dad-of-two will this week take on a cha cha cha set to Aston Merrygold’s Get Stupid in the hopes that his high scores will continue.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday on BBC One.
